title: IATF 16949:2016 - Quality Management System Specifics for Automotive Industry
headline: In this free online IATF 16949 certification course learn about the requirements of QMS for the Automotive Industry.
description: The free online IATF 16949 certification training course offers a comprehensive learning opportunity for automotive professionals and those looking to join the auto industry. The IATF 16949:2016 standard is the international standard for automobile manufacturers, suppliers and vendors to manage their QMS effectively. Study this course today and enhance your career by staying up to date with the new changes in this important IATF standard.
courseDescription:
IATF 16949:2016 is the first edition following a series of editions on ISO/TS 16949 standard (Three Editions were released). Under the IATF, it is the first publication. The updated standard explains the requirements for a quality management system (QMS) where an organization can demonstrate its capability to supply automobiles and associated components and services so that the organization can fulfill customer and relevant automotive industry requirements consistently.

This course begins by covering the context of the publication of this IATF standard, and reviews the various associated standards and earlier editions of this publication. Then the course highlights important terminology related to the automotive industry. The course explains all the requirements of IATF 16940 including contingency plans, control of rework products, control plans, error proofing, problem solving, supplier development, prototype programs, confidentiality, engineering specifications etc. The course also covers the Clause - 8 of IATF 16940 standard and explains all about the operational requirements.

If you’re interested in a career as a quality assurance professional in the automotive industry, or if you’re a compliance professional seeking to keep up to date with the latest IATF 16949 standard, then this clear and simple course is for you. Understanding IATF 16949:2016 is of vital importance for all professionals working in the automotive sector. So, start this free online course today and in just 3 hours you’ll be up to date with the new changes in this important IATF 16949 standard.

• Learning Outcomes

  • After completing this module, you will be able to:
    • Narrate benefits of IATF 16949:2016.
    • Trace the development of IATF 16949:2016.
    • Explain practical steps to company certification on IATF 16949:2016.
    • Examine types of available personal certifications. Realize standard terminologies and definitions related to advanced product quality planning (APQP), challenge (master) part, control plan, design for assembly (DFA) etc.
    • State existing standards on Automotive Quality Management System. 
    • Describe ISO 9001 and why it is important for Automotive QMS.
    • Differentiate ISO/TS 16949:2009 and IATF 16949:2016.
    • Learn the summary of IATF 16949:2016.covering all auditable clauses. 
    • List the mandatory documents defined in IATF 16949:2016.
  • What is IATF 16949:2016 Standard?
  • IATF 16949 provides the Quality Management System requirements for automotive production and relevant service parts organizations. The goal of this Automotive QMS standard is the creation of a quality management system that provides continual improvement, emphasizes defect prevention and reduces variation and waste in the supply chain.

    This Automotive QMS Standard cannot be consumed as a single independent QMS Standard but has to be comprehended as a supplemental additional document in conjunction with ISO 9001:2015. It means that it provides additional requirements and references the fundamental requirements of ISO 9001:2015.
  • Mandatory Prerequisite to take IATF 16949:2016 Online Course
  • The mandatory prerequisite to taking this free online course is a detailed understanding of ISO 9001:2015 standard which is a general-purpose Quality Management System standard.

    However, if you have not worked on ISO 9001 nor have taken any course or training on ISO 9001:2015, Alison provides you with an opportunity to complete the course on ISO 9001:2015 - Quality Management System (QMS) which provides you with a basic understanding of ISO 9001:2015.

  • Lesson Summary

  •  The key points from this module are:
    • IATF 16949 provides the Quality Management System requirements for automotive production and relevant service parts organisations.
    • This Automotive QMS Standard cannot be consumed as a single independent QMS Standard but has to be comprehended as a supplemental additional document in conjunction with ISO 9001:2015.
    • The framework of documentation in an automotive industry specifies the organization's rules that will direct how a company produces and supplies automobile or automotive components to its customers.
    • The advantages of IATF 16949 cannot be overemphasized; organizations in the automotive sector whether big or small used this standard to enhance their performance, reducing cost and making organizations more efficient.
    • The QMS should be customized to the nature and environment of an automotive supplier or manufacturer. To get your company IATF 16949 certified, you need to hire a recognized certification body to audit and approve your QMS (as meeting the requirements of the IATF 16949 standard).

  • Context of Organization (Clause - 4)
  • Examining the IATF 16949 standard, it’s evident that there are no additional requirements for assessing the context of the organization except some additional requirements on scope, customer-specific issues and product safety. Therefore an organization simply wants to ensure it complies with the ISO 9001 requirements and some specific requirements to confirm the fulfilment of the IATF 16949 standard.

      • Clearly Defined responsibilities, explanation of escalation process and flow of information, along with identification of escalation to top management, and to the customer notification

    • Product Safety (Clause - 4.4.1.2)
      The company needs to have documented processes for the management of product-safety-related products and manufacturing processes, which must include but not be limited to the listing below (as relevant):

      • Recognition by the organization of statutory and regulatory product-safety requirements
      • Customer-led notification of requirements in item
      • Special approvals for design FMEA (Failure Mode Effect Analysis)
      • Recognition of product safety-related characteristics
      • Recognition and controls of safety-related qualities of the product and at the point of production
      • Special approval of control plans and process FMEAs
      • Plans to react or simply as reaction plan (check Clause - 9.1.1.1)
      • Clearly Defined responsibilities, explanation of escalation process and flow of information, along with identification of escalation to top management, and to the customer notification
      • Training identified by the organization or customer for personnel involved in product safety concerning products and related production processes
      • Changes in product or process need to be approved before implementation, along with an assessment of potential effects on product safety from the process and product changes (check ISO 9001, Clause - 8.3.6)
      • Circulation of requirements concerning product safety all through the supply chain, along with customer-designated sources (check Clause - 8.4.3.1)
      • Minimum Product Traceability by manufactured lot all through the supply chain (check Clause - 8.5.2.1);
      • Lessons learned for new product identification and idea inception.

      Please note that special approval is a supplemental approval by the function (usually the consumer); who is responsible to endorse these documents with safety-related issues in it.

    • Preventive Action (Clause - 6.1.2.2)
      The organization needs to identify and implement actions to eliminate the causes of potential non-conformities in order to prevent their occurrence. Preventive actions shall be appropriate to the severity of the potential issues.

      The company needs to develop a process to minimize the impact of negative effects of risk including the following:

      • Determining potential non-conformities and their causes
      • Evaluating the need for action to prevent occurrence of non-conformities
      • Determining and implementing action needed
      • Documented information of action taken
      • Reviewing the effectiveness of the preventive action taken
      • Utilizing lessons learned to prevent recurrence in similar processes (see ISO 9001, Section 7.1.6)

    • Contingency Plan (Clause - 6.1.2.3)
      The organization needs to do following under the contingency plans:

      • Identify and assess internal and external risks to all manufacturing processes and infrastructure equipment essential to maintain production output and to ensure that customer requirements are met.

      • Define and explain contingency plans as per the risk and impact to the customer.
      • Prepare contingency plans for continuity of supply in the occurrence of any of the following:
      • Key and important equipment
      • Failures (check Clause - 8.5.6.1.1)
      • Interruption from externally provided products, processes, and services; recurring natural disasters like fire
      • Utility interruptions
      • Labor shortages
      • Infrastructure disruptions
      • Incorporate, along with the contingency plans, a notification process to the customer and relevant interested parties for the magnitude and span of any event impacting customer operations
      • Periodically test the contingency plans for effectiveness (for instance simulations, as relevant)
      • Implement contingency plan reviews (at a minimum annually) utilizing a multidisciplinary team including top management, and update as needed
      • Document the contingency plans and retain documented information explaining any revision, along with the person who authorized the modification

      The contingency plans needs to have provisions to validate that the manufactured product fulfills to comply customer specifications.

    • Monitoring and Measurement of Manufacturing Processes (Clause - 9.1.1.1)
      The company must perform process studies on every new manufacturing (including assembly or sequencing) processes to verify process capability and to provide additional input for process control, including those for special characteristics. It is also important here to note that for some manufacturing processes, it may not be possible to demonstrate product compliance through process capability.
